H0.text: which body part ( s ) occupy the greatest portion of the primary motor cortex. Hands

H1.text: which body part ( s ) occupy the greatest portion of the primary motor cortex. Fingers

H2.text: which body part ( s ) occupy the greatest portion of the primary motor cortex. Tongue

H3.text: which body part ( s ) occupy the greatest portion of the primary motor cortex. face

A4.text: The human hands and face have a much larger representation than the legs.

A5.text: The lips, face parts, and hands are represented by particularly large areas due to the comparative enrichment and density of motor receptor in these regions.

A6.text: The motor areas are very closely related to the control of voluntary movements, especially fine fragmented movements performed by the hand.
